issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.
status.name: Patch Available

fields.summary: fsck prints that it's using KSSL even when it's in fact using SPNEGO for authentication

comments.body: I should've mentioned, this issue was discovered by Stephen Chu.

I think I saw this hardcoded while fixing {{JspHelper}} for proxy tokens.  I question whether KERBEROS_SSL or a new KERBEROS_SPNEGO is needed instead of just KERBEROS.  Do we really care about the mechanism used to perform the kerberos auth?

I'm not aware of any reason to distinguish between the two. At the very least there's certainly no need to distinguish between the two in the UserGroupInformation#toString method, which is where this output stems from.

I think it should not be harmful to keep the sub-mechanism info around. We could just rename the KERBEROS_SSL into KERBEROS_SPNEGO on trunk I think, since we do not use/support KERBEROS_SSL (KSSL) anymore in trunk and branch-2?

\\
